column1: It was the first Saturday of the regular fall term at Miss Allen's Boarding School. The girls were back again in their old places—all except the seniors of the previous year
column2: who had graduated—and now the sophomores were preparing for the first social event of the year
column3: their reception to the freshmen. Marjorie Wilkinson was chairman.The clock struck seven
column4: and she stood perfectly still in the center of the floor
column5: viewing the result of their work. The bare
column6: ugly gymnasium had disappeared; in its place was a little winter scene from fairyland. Cedar branches
column7: decked with flakes of artificial snow
column9: completely hid the walls from view. Spread over the floor
column10: except for a space in the middle reserved for dancing
column11: were pine needles and more patches of snow; and everywhere frosty tinsel glimmered in the soft
column12: blue light of the covered electric bulbs.The girls walked lightly and spoke softly
column13: as if they feared that by some rude noise they might break the magic spell of the scene.
